name: Andaz Napa

reviews.title: My new favorite hotel!
reviews.text: As a previous reviewer said this hotel does everything right. To begin we were thrilled with double king beds -unheard of in the hotel industry. Gorgeous contemporary boutique style hotel - staff is friendly and helpful. Good restaurant, fun lobby bar, complimentary wine tastings in the evening. Mimosas are the best I've ever had! Walk to everything in downtown Napa. Would not stay anywhere else.

reviews.title: Enjoyable
reviews.text: I only stayed here one night, but my husband and I had a great experience. We would definitely return. We appreciated that although they didn't have a gym, they had a partnership with a gym on the same block, so we were able to work out. It is also walking distance to many great local restaurants.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: we loved this hotel. Pam, the conierge could not have been more helpful . We communicated a lot via email prior to our trip regarding wineries and restaurants. This hotel is very centrally located in Napa. it is within walking distance to the great restaurants and sights in napa. The room was perfect with a partial view of the hills. Check in was speedy as was check out. Loved the complimentary shoulder massage and wine and beer. I will be back here for sure!!
reviews.title: perfect location, great concierge and wonderful rooms

reviews.text: This is a super hotel with a great staff of helpful people. Our room was very large and comfortable. The common areas were always buzzing. Water with lemon and coffee are free in the lobby. Close to many great wineries.
reviews.title: Great end to a day of wine tasting

reviews.text: Arrived at this very chic boutique hotel and was pleasantly surprised to be brought up to a suite with a terrace! The people are extremely helpful, and treat each guest as a VIP. Recommendations for restaurants were wonderful and allowed us to discover some very local places... The suite is very elegantly designed and has all the necessary amenities. The bed was extremely comfortable! (Unfortunately the pull out bed in the sofa where our boys slept was not...)
reviews.title: Andaz, take me away!
Downtown Napa becoming a fun place to stay
reviews.text: Who doesn't like staying in the Valley of wine, women and song?? Great wines, great vistas, great food, lovely spas, etc..., etc. etc.....

reviews.title: Quality quiet quaint experience
reviews.text: We live about an hour away but try to come to the wine country at least every few months. But......the city of Napa is not IN the valley (still a good car distance south from the wineries) and we have rarely visited downtown. And, we have never stayed this far south. But the city of Napa is changing. New development have introduced quaint walking streets, riverfront walkways, art galleries, tasting rooms and tons of interesting restaurants.

reviews.title: Excellent hotel in downtown Napa
reviews.text: The Andaz is in a great location, the center of it all. Everything is walkable. The lobby was under construction when we arrived so the transition from the Avia was still in process. Although we never stayed there, our impression of the Avia was very slick, modern and trendy. The Andaz is going for a more rustic, barn, vineyard feel. The success of the merging of the two opposite styles remains to be seen.

reviews.title: Great Downtown Location
reviews.text: The rooms are large and you can see that much of the furniture and decor from the Avia still dominates. I don't know the plans for upgrading. Not that what's there is bad, but some items showed wear in what is supposed to be a new themed hotel.

reviews.title: Modern, trendy, new and comfortable
reviews.text: The bed and sheets were very comfortable. The towels could be upgraded but we loved the rain shower! The free minibar items was an appreciated touch.

reviews.title: Lovely hotel
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed here for two nights. The suite we booked was huge, with tasteful decor, a huge bathroom, an in room soaking tub and fireplace, all equipping us to relax in style. The minibar offerings were free (except alcohol, understandably), the restaurant's food was amazing, and the hotel's service delivered with a smile. The location was central, right near the many restaurants and shops and not too far from the Oxbow Market. There were a few minor drawbacks... The restaurant service was a little slow, the gym and parking are next door or a block away rather than in the building. These didn't preclude an enjoyable stay, however, and we had a terrific time.

reviews.title: Nice hotel but some issues, not worth the price
reviews.text: We stayed at the hotel the first weekend after it was converted to the Andaz. The hotel itself is beautiful -- the lobby and rooms are very nice, and the decor is great. However, there were a few issues that I wouldn't have expected given the price and caliber of the hotel. This could have been due to the opening weekend, but the front desk was fairly unorganized during our stay. It took much longer than they originally told us for our room to be ready, and at times the front desk was totally unmanned. The pool / fitness center adjacent to the hotel is also pretty low quality. And when we woke up in the morning we found an old, dirty used pencil underneath the sheets that seemed like it was from the last person to stay in the room. Not sure if this meant that they didn't fully change the sheets / blankets when cleaning the room. I'm usually not too picky about hotels, but wouldn't have expected this from Andaz.

reviews.title: Ultimate in customer service, great location.
reviews.text: The Andaz Napa is the ultimate in customer service! Check-in was seamless and easy. Free parking, free snacks. A wonderful outdoor patio on the second floor with fire pits and cabanas to enjoy your wine. The bar on the first floor was excellent. Service was an A+. Very close to everything downtown, great shops, restaurants, wine tasting rooms. The place to stay in Napa! Highly recommended.

reviews.title: Best Service Ever.
reviews.text: I stayed here for a few nights as part of a Girl's Weekend during crush season. The hotel is centrally located in downtown Napa and within walking distance of lots of cute shops and good restaurants. I picked largely based on location, but also because the room size was generally bigger than other hotels and the double occupancy rooms were two king beds (as opposed to two queens). Before I arrived, the concierge was lovely enough to make some restaurant suggestions and reservations. She also recommended a wine tour (Platypus Tours - $99/ea) that was very reasonable (and a ton of fun)!

reviews.title: Wonderful experience in Napa
reviews.text: The hotel room was spacious, clean and comfortable. The shower was amazing and the marble bathroom was roomy and well-lit. The mini-bar was complimentary - that's right, drink as much soda or water and have as many snacks as you want, all at no charge. There is a fancy coffee maker in the room and when we ran out of coffee pods, we called downstairs and more arrived in just a few minutes. The room comes with a DVD player and the hotel has a large collection of movies you can check out for free.

description: Andaz Napa. A fresh, relaxed take on modern travel that embodies the art of living well by infusing local authentic experiences, inspiring design the highest levels of service and a sophisticated sense of place. This lifestyle boutique hotel combines understated elegance with all the enthusiasm of a gracious local host, ideally situated in the heart of downtown Napa. Steps away are various attractions such as world-class wine tasting rooms and restaurants, boutique shopping, art museums, The Napa Valley Opera House, Uptown Theater and much more. The uniqueness of Andaz begins the moment you arrive. An Andaz host will greet you, and can check you in on the way to your room or you can take a moment and enjoy a complimentary beverage in the Andaz lounge while you check in. Our lounge is an open, communal space that replaces the traditional lobby and is perfect for drinks in the evening or a quick coffee in the morning. Our rooms feature luxurious king beds, 9-foot ceilings, hickory hardwood floors, and Eastern White Marble bathrooms with oversized walk-in showers and waterfall shower heads. We also offer complimentary wired and wireless internet, complimentary self-parking and complimentary non-alcoholic beverages and snacks.
